DataElement.preferredDefinition: The primary anatomic site/organ from which the biospecimen was obtained.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: text that describes the anatomical location from which a biopsy specimen was collected.
